derivation.yuyuan_name: late Middle English: from Latin peroratio(n-), from perorare 'speak at length' (see perorate)

entry.def: A peroration is the last part of a speech, especially the part where the speaker sums up his or her argument.
If someone describes a speech as a peroration, they mean that they dislike it because they think it is very long and not worth listening to.

means.word_mean: 1. a flowery and highly rhetorical oration
2. (rhetoric) the concluding section of an oration;

sentences.sentence: "he summarized his main points in his peroration"
